author: Jessica
title: appending labels
question:
hi, 

I was wondering why it must follow that we are appending a compound data type’s label onto the visited accumulator. 

Because my thought process was: wouldn’t it be better to append the the whole compound data element to visited? Doing this, couldn’t we have cond questions that check for other parts of the element? 

If we only append the label of a compound element, then our accumulator has only stored a list of strings. If we want to check for example, the destination of that element, we wouldn’t be able to do it using the acc, we would have to used fn-for-something-else

thanks, just wondering
instructor_answer:
Yes, you could put the entire element onto visited or path, and sometimes it is quite helpful to do that. It lets you do just what you say -- access other fields of the previous elements.
Both member and member? will work to test whether the item is in the list.
